data.title: GG18 - Climate Round
data.description: Grants in this round are primarily focused on climate solutions (the group may do other work, but the grant proposal must be directly related to climate solutions). The projects are explicitly helping to reduce GHGs, and/or serve as an important core infrastructure for web3 climate solution
Provide financial assistance to the learning activities at the Sueños del Bosque school for children in Barichara to host community activities and support teaching staff at the school.
data.title: Sueños del Bosque School

data.reason: We have been holding community learning activities in Barichara throughout the year. You can see our ongoing activities on our Instagram account: https://www.instagram.com/suenos_del_bosque_barichara/.

data.description: Part of the funds from this Gitcoin round will go to the Origen del Agua nature reserve to support educational workshops with local children, application of syntropic agroforestry to landscape restoration, and maintenance of reforestation processes.
data.title: Reforestation at Origen del Agua

data.name: Ma Earth
data.description: Ma Earth is a community-led movement to align economic incentives with planetary health and regeneration.

data.title: Reforestation of Origen del Agua Nature Reserve
data.description: Part of the nearly $2000 that we received in this climate round will go to the Origen del Agua Nature Reserve to support tree plantings and reforestation work within its 3.2 hectare area.

data.title: Support Regenerative Education with Sueños del Bosque School
data.description: We received close to $2000 from this Gitcoin round and part of it is going to support regenerative education with teachers in Barichara who offer Waldorf-inspired curricula for helping children in the territory to connect with native ecosystems and cultivate conscience for the regeneration of the Tropical Dry Forest in our region.

questions.query: Is your project a member or past grantee of one of these networks?
What are your key active goals, plans, objectives or milestones for this year?
questions.explanation:
This year we are catalyzing a new level of activation for our bioregional learning ecosystem -- weaving many local initiatives around the restoration of forest, water, and soils.

We have a regenerative school for children called Sueños del Bosque and are working with the community forest Bioparque Móncora to establish a learning site for the restoration of our tropical dry forest. We also continue supporting the nature reserve Origin del Agua in its reforestation and community education activities.

These are our main focus areas in this funding round. Please give our local projects some love!

data.name: Regen Coordination
data.description: The Regen Coordination Round is a proposal for a GG21 community round centered on the themes of Coordi-nations 3, Cosmo-localism 2, Bio-Regionalism 3, and Regenerative Finance (ReFi) 3. Bringing together GreenPill Network 1, ReFi DAO 1, Celo Regional DAOs 1 and Regens Unite 1, we aim to support a global movement of regenerative communities leveraging Web3 for real-world impact and addressing local needs. The round will feed into a program to support the further development of local community impact tracking methodologies, grant tooling interoperability, and integrated QF & RPGF. We have currently secured $60K in funding from Celo Public Goods, ReFi DAO and Greenpill and ask for Gitcoin’s backing as we embark on a shared mission to showcase how community coordination, Web3, and innovative financial mechanisms can enable ecological and social regeneration on a global scale.
